description: September 14, 2020: With Bulletin N. 262, the Italian Ministry of Health announced that the Italian Minister of Health, Roberto Speranza, has attended the 70th session of the WHO Regional Committee for Europe (RC70), organised by the WHO Regional Office for Europe, on September 14 and 15, 2020. Representatives of 53 countries in the WHO European Region have attended. Representatives of WHO partners such as United Nations agencies and other intergovernmental organisations and regional networks, were also present. Non-State actors (NSAs) in official relations with WHO and regional NSAs accredited by the Regional Committee, have followed the webstream and had the opportunity to submit video and written statements in advance. The key health issues and future plans have been discussed, particularly on themes regarding the response to the COVID-19 pandemic and lessons learned from the pandemic, both globally and regionally.

description: Bosnia and Herzegovina, July 17 - federal government declared a state of sanitary epidemic situation regarding COVID 19. The proclamation of the COVID-19 epidemic on the entire territory of the Federative Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina (FBIH) does not directly concern the population, but implies more operative action of all relevant institutions that act in this situation, and implements measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19 on the territory of FBiH.If necessary and depending on the situation, the order envisages the possibility of sanitary control at border crossings located on the territory of the Federation of BiH and implementation of measures related to that control, quarantine, provision of necessary vaccine reserves when vaccines are available, immunization of population when vaccines are available. , as well as the implementation of other measures ordered by the Federal Minister of Health or the Government of the Federation of BiH.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_vac_cat: Sputnik V vaccine (Gam-COVID-Vac; by Gamaleya Research Institute of Epidemiology and Microbiology)
type_vac_mix: This distribution policy is not about mixing and matching of different vaccines.
type_vac_who_pays: Vaccine is free for the individual
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The government of Bosnia and Herzegovia has relaxed an external border restriction by reopening the Sarajevo airport to select countries and passengers on July 16, 2020. UPDATE: The original travel ban suspended all commercial passenger travel, but as of July 16, BiH has opened air travel to all EU citizens and residents, as well as nationals of Bosnia and Herzegovina returning home and Croatian, Montenegrin and Serbian nationals.

description: On March 15, the Government of the Brcko District of Bosnia and Herzegovina required businesses such as "restaurants, cafes,  discos, pharmacy shops, hotels etc." to comply with the following recommendations:- Ensure good ventilation of the premises- Regular cleaning and disinfection of toilets- Provide access to places where hands can be washed with soapy water- Provide visibly visible hand sanitizers (replenish regularly)- To arrange seating arrangements in catering establishments so as to provide a distance of at least one meter between guests.- At stores observe a distance of at least one meter when waiting in line at the cash register.

description: On March 18, the Goverment of the Brcko District of Bosnia and Herzegovina announced the prohibition to work with economic operators engaged in trade. Exceptions are made regarding:a) filling stations in accordance with the prescribed working hours, and a ban on the part of the filling station in which the catering activity is performed ;b) trade in food and consumer goods (hygiene and personal hygiene products, etc.) by 6:00 pm;c) trade of food and consumer goods (hygiene and personal hygiene products, etc.) within the shopping malls by 6:00 pm;d) Trade in protective equipment by 6:00 pm.- Undertakings which are prohibited from engaging in a commercial activity that provide goods for the required activities which are permitted to work in accordance with this Order may apply to the Crisis Staff for approval of the delivery of goods.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: From March 18 on, it is prohibited to work:a) dental practice in private practice;b)      bookmakers and betting shops and similar facilities;c)      bridal parlors, birthday parties, daycare facilities and similar facilities;d)     gyms, fitness centers and similar forms of activity and organization;e)      hairdressing salons, beauty salons, massage parlors, solariums, barber shops and similar facilities;Exceptions are made to:a) artisans (electricians, vulcanizers, car services, car wash, etc.);b) construction companies, warehouses and the like;c) taxi drivers;d) pharmacies by 10:00 pm;e) agricultural and veterinary pharmacies, as well as animal feed stores, pet food stores by 6:00 pm;f) Funeral services with ancillary equipment.g) It is prohibited for economic operators engaged in the catering activity to serve food and drink in the facilities.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Bosnia and Herzegovina Federal Government by order from March 17 (extended by order from March 27, April 17 and April 29), forbid the work of hotels, restaurants, fast food, bars and similar eating and catering facilities.

This measure was cancelled by order from May 12 that allowed these facilities to provide cervices in their outdoor areas (gardens and terraces). Usage and consumption of shishas remains forbidden. UPDATE: The prohibition was ended on May 12.

description:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - from. July 7 public gatherings in Federation are limited to 100 people in the closed and 300 people in the open area.  

All gatherings within these limits must take place in a space that allows a mandatory physical distance of at least 2 meters between persons (except for the people from the same household).

In order to reduce the risk of COVID-19, as well as the protection of personal health, during the gathering, it is necessary to adhere to the recommendations made by the Institute of Public Health in the Federation of BiH (hygienic and epidemiological measures). 

The organizers of the gatherings are responsible for the implementation of measures at the rallies. The organizer is obliged to register the holding of the meeting in accordance with the regulations on public gatherings, as well as the crisis headquarters of the cantonal / county ministries of health.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force
